forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 55. Southwest wind 8 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

weather_report:
As the night unfurls over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle tranquility envelops the city, underscored by the soft rustle of leaves swaying in the cool southwestern breeze. Currently resting at a comfortable 55 degrees, the skies are partly cloudy, casting a delicate veil over the glimmering lights below. The wind whispers promises of a shift, with gusts that could nudge the threshold of 18 miles per hour, creating an atmosphere of mild excitement that hints at the dynamic day ahead.

Come Thursday, the city can expect a flirtation with sunshine, yielding a high near 64, dipping slightly after noon to a more temperate 62. As the clouds continue to dance, there may still be remnants of the marine layer lingering near the coast, though clearing should grant a more picturesque view of the iconic Golden Gate standing proud in the distance. The brisk winds, reaching up to 29 mph at their peak, may wrap around you like a playful companion, so consider layering a light jacket over your favorite cotton tee. Perhaps it is an ideal moment to embrace the urban landscape with a leisurely stroll along the waterfront or to find solace in the quiet corners of a bustling café, allowing a warm drink to melt away the chill in the air, while the city unfolds its secrets, one gentle breeze at a time.
